org.gbif.crawler

Interface CrawlClient<REQUEST,RESPONSE>

  • Type Parameters:
    REQUEST - format of the request to process. This is expected to be mostly a String but could be a complex object if needed
    RESPONSE - the type of the response that the CrawlClient produces which the ResponseHandler will have to process
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HttpCrawlClient

    public interface CrawlClient<REQUEST,RESPONSE>
    Implementations of this interface take responsibility for interactions with endpoints. They take some form of request, a handler that processes the response of this request into a result.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <RESULT> RESULT execute(REQUEST request, ResponseHandler<RESPONSE,RESULT> handler)
      Executes the request and lets a ResponseHandler handle it and returns its result.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        <RESULT> RESULT execute(REQUEST request,
                      ResponseHandler<RESPONSE,RESULT> handler)
               throws FatalCrawlException,
                      TransportException,
                      ProtocolException
        Executes the request and lets a ResponseHandler handle it and returns its result.
        Parameters:
        request - that should be issued
        handler - to process the response and that produces the result
        Throws:
        TransportException - on transport error, such as timeout, unable to connect etc.
        ProtocolException - on error during handling of the response (e.g. such as a unexpected format, XML issues)
        FatalCrawlException
